19bd55f4-7be8-4d62-a60b-ccf2296d6efc.description: Instructors rate a student artifact or assignment produced in a course that targets Teamwork. Teamwork is behaviors under the control of individual team members (effort they put into team tasks, their manner of interacting with others on team, and the quantity and quality of contributions they make to team discussions). Examples of artifacts include a research paper, group presentation, project, or skill demonstration. The skills are measured through observable behavior or performance.
19bd55f4-7be8-4d62-a60b-ccf2296d6efc.name: Workforce Skills: Teamwork

badge_template_activities.title: Contributes to Team Meetings - Offers alternative solutions or courses of action that build on the ideas of others.
Facilitates the Contributions of Team Members - Engages team members in ways that facilitate their contributions to meetings by building upon or combining the contributions of others.
Individual Contributions Outside of Team Meetings - Completes all assigned tasks by deadline; work accomplished is thorough, comprehensive, and advances the project.

Fosters Constructive Team Climate - Supports a constructive team climate by doing 3 of the following: • Treats team members respectfully by being polite and constructive in communication. • Uses positive vocal or written tone, facial expressions, and body language to convey a positive attitude about the team and its work • Motivates teammates by expressing confidence about the importance of the task and the team’s ability to accomplish it • Provides assistance and encouragement to team members
Responds to Conflict - Identifies and acknowledges conflict and stays engaged with it.

bc97b5ad-11b3-448d-bd51-6439bbbc2a59.description: SOLO’s Wilderness First Responder (WFR) course is the recognized industry standard leading to certification. The WFR is 72+ hours long, and is a comprehensive and in-depth look at the standards and skills of dealing with: Response and Assessment, Musculoskeletal Injuries, Environmental Emergencies and Survival Skills, Soft Tissue Injuries, Medical Emergencies, and CPR
bc97b5ad-11b3-448d-bd51-6439bbbc2a59.name: SOLO Wilderness First Responder

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in the 72 hour Wilderness First Responder course
Successfully pass written certification exam
Successfully pass wilderness practical exams

11309f52-8c34-47ae-8123-87b6c09db574.description: The course offers an abbreviated exposure to the WEA 6+1(Outdoor Living, Planning and Logistics, Risk Management, Leadership, Environmental Integration, and Education + Judgment) with role modeling of field leadership and instruction. Participants explore the leadership side of an outdoor experience.
11309f52-8c34-47ae-8123-87b6c09db574.name: Wilderness Education Association Outdoor Leadership Experience

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in a three-day "backcountry" field experience (including staying overnight) where the WEA 6+1 leadership model is followed.
Possess a brief understanding of the history outdoor leadership.

47c65d88-d076-463a-b65f-20576d30b961.description: Participants in the two-day Leave No Trace Outdoor Ethics Trainer Course learn Leave No Trace skills and ethics as well as techniques for educating others about these low impact practices. Graduates of a Trainer Course are prepared to offer Leave No Trace Awareness Workshops to their community.
47c65d88-d076-463a-b65f-20576d30b961.name: Leave No Trace Outdoor Ethics Trainer

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in a two-day LNT trainer course (field-based)
Learn how to teach LNT topics in both a formal and non-formal settings

c53ba578-369b-40c7-952e-63f7512e2c55.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate introductory spreadsheet skills by performing tasks to create and format a variety of business applications. e.g., create and edit worksheets, use basic formulas and functions (sum, count, average, max, min, round, if, and, or), insert and format charts
c53ba578-369b-40c7-952e-63f7512e2c55.name: Introductory Excel (Microsoft 365)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a spreadsheet checkpoint at 80 percent or higher to unlock access to the proctored assessment.
Complete a proctored spreadsheet assessment at 80 percent or higher to earn the badge.

c9c277b1-7ff2-4632-af13-7065b2dcd696.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate introductory presentation software skills (utilizing Microsoft PowerPoint) by performing tasks to create and edit a variety of slide presentations. e.g., modify and format slides, apply transitions, add animation, insert objects and hyperlinks
c9c277b1-7ff2-4632-af13-7065b2dcd696.name: Introductory PowerPoint (Microsoft 365)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a presentation checkpoint at 80 percent or higher to unlock access to the proctored assessment.
Complete a proctored presentation assessment at 80 percent or higher to earn the badge.

c9974ac2-03e3-4188-b066-e7992b308089.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate introductory word processing skills (utilizing Microsoft Word) by performing tasks to create and edit a variety of business documents. e.g.,retrieve, format, and save documents; use print options (headers/footers, page numbers); insert and format tables, add research information (citations, bibliography), insert graphic objects (SmartArt, images, shapes, etc.)
c9974ac2-03e3-4188-b066-e7992b308089.name: Introductory Word (Microsoft 365)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a word processing checkpoint at 80 percent or higher to unlock access to the proctored assessment.
Complete a proctored word processing assessment at 80 percent or higher to earn the badge.

c2376ef6-b238-40e2-89ca-9b11866ae534.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate understanding of basic technology concepts and terminology and perform basic computer tasks. e.g., operating systems, file management, email, browsers, security, ethics, smart phones/homes/products, artificial intelligence, virtual reality.
c2376ef6-b238-40e2-89ca-9b11866ae534.name: Technology Concepts

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a technology concepts checkpoint at 80 percent or higher to unlock access to the proctored assessment.
Complete a proctored assessment of technology concepts at 80 percent or higher to earn the badge.

2004a198-530b-4429-a6a8-25f75e1408cf.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate skills by completing an integrated project using Word, Excel, and PowerPoint to create, organize, and share information to show understanding of technology concepts, appropriate software features, and professional standards.
2004a198-530b-4429-a6a8-25f75e1408cf.name: Introductory Integrated Project (Microsoft 365)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Technology Concepts, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint checkpoint at 80 percent or higher to unlock the Integrated Project.
Complete an integrated project assessment at 80 percent or higher using Technology Concepts, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

a8caf77d-a601-4236-8a9a-89a5112c7331.description: Individuals who earn this badge have demonstrated beginning proficiency in Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and basic technology concepts. This includes operating systems, file management, email, browsers, security, ethics, format documents, insert and format tables, add research information, insert graphic objects, create and edit a variety of slide presentations, create and edit worksheets, use basic formulas and functions, and insert and format charts. This has been tested through a capstone project
a8caf77d-a601-4236-8a9a-89a5112c7331.name: Introductory Microsoft 365

badge_template_activities.title: Technology Concepts
Introductory Word (Microsoft 365)
Introductory PowerPoint (Microsoft 365)
Introductory Excel (Microsoft 365)
Introductory Integrated Project (Microsoft 365)

17b2796d-b1d2-4902-95cb-6ba24cfd406e.description: The earner of this badge has completed basic training on the safety and operational aspects of operating industrial powered trucks in the work environment. The earner is knowledgeable of OSHA regulations related to forklift safety. The earner has a broad understanding of topics such as jobsite area inspection, authorization requirements, forklift types, hazard analysis, and pre-operational inspections.
17b2796d-b1d2-4902-95cb-6ba24cfd406e.name: Forklift Safety Training

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all assessments in the on-line course

ba78360f-6eeb-4c9a-923b-66ba97faa6bd.description: Earners of this badge learn the power and importance of goal-setting, what makes an effective goal, how to turn your dreams and life missions into actionable goals, and formats to use for managing and updating your goals list.
ba78360f-6eeb-4c9a-923b-66ba97faa6bd.name: Architecting Goals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Architecting Goals module, including all related activities
Complete the Architecting Goals module assessment at 80% or above

c3d44744-7ae8-4196-84b6-362c2dc32127.description: Individuals can identify and describe standard and special dump trucks and trailers, dump truck instruments and control systems, and normal driving practices. They understand how to operate a dump truck safely and handle a dump truck in an emergency. They can inspect, maintain, startup, warm-up and shutdown a dump truck and perform basic operations, including dumping a load, tailgate attachment and back up with a trailer.
c3d44744-7ae8-4196-84b6-362c2dc32127.name: Articulated Dump Truck Operation

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class
Complete and pass all objectives on the simulator

dd7f4646-2ad6-42ca-8e53-6827616fb29c.description: Individuals are familiar with common types, uses and configurations of backhoes. They can identify the instruments, controls, components and attachments of a typical backhoe. They are aware of safety, inspection and maintenance guidelines. They are able to safely start up, maneuver and shut down a backhoe. They can safely perform basic backhoe operations including loading, trenching, demolition and excavation. They can explain how to safely road and transport a backhoe.
dd7f4646-2ad6-42ca-8e53-6827616fb29c.name: Backhoe Operation

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class
Complete and pass all objectives on the simulator

ab3d168c-6348-4197-a0f0-7561b4bb3923.description: Individuals understand the hazards of working with and around heavy equipment. They can identify signs, barriers and other devices used for work zone safety. They are aware of methods used to control traffic and noise. They are familiar with OSHA, MSHA and NIOSH requirements. They can describe personal protective equipment and hazard communication. They can identify safety practices associated with trenches and excavations. They understand how to safely maintain and operate heavy equipment.
ab3d168c-6348-4197-a0f0-7561b4bb3923.name: Basic Operational Techniques and Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class

8bfde4bc-f707-454a-8596-4b9e089002dd.description: If you want to be part of a team that can really get things done, you first need to know what makes a good team and how they get that way. Earners come to understand the value of working at being part of a good team, including the common characteristics of "dream" teams. They can identify the typical steps and strategies for how teams learn to work together and how to spot and manage the growing pains teams feel as they develop.
8bfde4bc-f707-454a-8596-4b9e089002dd.name: Building a Dream Team

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Building a Dream Team module, including all related activities
Complete the Building a Dream Team module assessment at 80% or above

233ae18f-9d1d-4e41-934c-8393982f425c.description: Individuals can identify common types of dozers and their components. They are familiar with dozer instrumentation, controls, blades and attachments. They are aware of safety, inspection and preventive maintenance guidelines. They can describe typical work activities associated with dozers. They are able to safely start up, maneuver and shut down dozers. They understand how to operate a dozer blade and can explain how rippers, winches and other attachments are used in dozer operations.
233ae18f-9d1d-4e41-934c-8393982f425c.name: Bulldozer Operation

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class
Complete and pass all objectives on the simulator

073aa838-3a4b-47d9-8be8-eb28340e20a7.description: Individuals can identify and describe the types of drawings for highway construction and building site construction, as well as how as-built drawings are prepared. They can identify and describe the lines, symbols and abbreviations of drawings and the types of information in specifications. They can determine the scale of drawings and interpret building site and highway drawings to determine excavation requirements.
073aa838-3a4b-47d9-8be8-eb28340e20a7.name: Civil Drawings

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class

9de0de2c-96c6-4b21-8cd7-26bcd0bcdfcd.description: Understanding your strengths unlocks your potential and leads you to greater performance. Earners of this badge will know their personal "Top 5" strengths, understand how they can use them in personal and professional life, and see the value of CliftonStrengths in team building. All 34 strengths will be covered and the earner will show they can develop stronger teams by identifying needs for as many of the 34 as possible in team building.
9de0de2c-96c6-4b21-8cd7-26bcd0bcdfcd.name: CliftonStrengths in Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Complete an "Understanding all 34 Strengths" quiz at 85% or above
Participate in a Strengths debrief with a Strengths Coach
Complete a Name, Claim, and Aim activity (Taking ownership of personal Strengths)
Create a "Complementary Team member" Top 5 Strengths
Compare and Share 2 personal strengths with another individual

5660deb9-940c-4a58-810a-83eeb9a6446d.description: By discovering how best to express yourself through words, body language, and tone you’ll be well on your way to building successful relationships, achieving goals, and moving forward in your life in meaningful ways. Earners will discover and explore what communication is and why it’s so critical for any type of relationship, the factors that influence or communication and the common causes of miscommunication, and critical communication strategies and techniques to apply to any relationship.
5660deb9-940c-4a58-810a-83eeb9a6446d.name: Communicating with Purpose

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Communicating with Purpose module, including all related activities
Complete the Communicating with Purpose module assessment at 80% or above

ae5c0f65-04cb-4e61-a729-ec6611a878a2.description: Trust is at the very core of our ability to connect and grow with others. It's vital to all relationships, which is why it's critical to know how to cultivate it and maintain it. Earners of this badge learn hat trust is and why it's so fundamental for any type of relationship. They learn how and why trust may not be built initially, and how it can be blocked or broken. Also, the 8 trust builders and how to apply them in real-world situations will be taught.
ae5c0f65-04cb-4e61-a729-ec6611a878a2.name: Cultivating Trust

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Cultivating Trust module, including all related activities
Complete the Cultivating Trust module assessment at 80% or above

03109cc9-ab21-4302-a045-07739ee16a90.description: Being part of a dynamic successful team starts with understanding how to create a positive culture. This includes understanding group development stages, building relationships and providing quality team building opportunities. Earners will understand and be able to identify the different stages of team development: Forming, Storming, Norming, Performing, and Transforming. They have led a team building activity to show competence and understanding of team building principles.
03109cc9-ab21-4302-a045-07739ee16a90.name: Developing a Team

badge_template_activities.title: Teach a group or team you are currently working with about the stages of development and identify when your group or team has been in each stage and what stage they are currently in. Discuss how relationships have changed and played a role through these stages.
Lead a team building activity cultivating relationship building and teamwork with a group or team you are currently working with. Write a summary on what activity you lead and how it was received.

ce082f3a-9956-4222-9e97-c1ce0f254f10.description: Individuals can describe how to plan and conduct earthmoving operations. They understand how plans and specifications are utilized. They are aware of the characteristics of different soils and can describe methods used to stabilize soil. They can explain how to lay out slopes and grades. They are familiar with fill, backfill and embankment construction. They can identify types of heavy equipment and methods used to load, haul and dump excavated soil. They are aware of related safety practices.
ce082f3a-9956-4222-9e97-c1ce0f254f10.name: Earthmoving Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class for Earthmoving

a40446bf-aae2-4752-a214-4343b1b8edea.description: Individuals can identify and describe angles and types of angles, how squares and square roots are derived, and the sequence of operations for solving formulas. They understand how to determine the length of a slope. They can calculate the area of squares, rectangles, triangles, trapezoid and circle, as well as the volume of a cube, prism and cylinder.
a40446bf-aae2-4752-a214-4343b1b8edea.name: Excavation Math

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class

88df76e3-02e6-4967-9cbc-c57773aa60e7.description: Individuals are able to identify common types of excavators and their components. They can describe hydraulic and telescoping-boom excavators and their instrumentation, controls, buckets and attachments. They are aware of safety, inspection and preventive maintenance guidelines. They can describe excavator work activities such as side sloping, finish grading, lifting, demolition and general excavation and trenching. They are able to safely start up, maneuver and shut down excavators.
88df76e3-02e6-4967-9cbc-c57773aa60e7.name: Excavator Operation

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class
Complete and pass all objectives on the simulator

869dd421-46f1-45d8-b87f-d1af5371c3b6.description: Individuals receive training on the safety and operational aspects of a forklift in the work environment through a simulator course. The learner has demonstrated knowledge in forklift operation, maintenance, capacity, stability, vehicle use and limitations.
869dd421-46f1-45d8-b87f-d1af5371c3b6.name: Forklift Operation

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all assessments on the simulator
Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class

8a1a829a-0937-4a83-a9c3-61b5f87adbf9.description: Individuals are familiar with heavy equipment used for finish grading including motor graders, dozers, scrapers and telescoping excavators. They can describe the function and components of laser-based grade control systems. They can describe materials and methods used to stabilize soils and control soil erosion. They can identify finishing and grading methods used for various applications.
8a1a829a-0937-4a83-a9c3-61b5f87adbf9.name: Grading Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class for Grading

f9392636-079d-40d4-9ebf-4cb5777c5925.description: When you know how to approach it in a healthy way, conflict can be one of the most powerful catalysts for new perspectives, stronger relationships, and personal growth. Earners explore an empowering way to approach conflict by uncovering how to recognize a conflict brewing and how to determine the causes of conflict and apply the best strategies to seek a resolution. They also learn how to extract benefits from engaging in conflict in a healthy way and approach conflicts in all relationships.
f9392636-079d-40d4-9ebf-4cb5777c5925.name: Growing Through Conflict

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Growing Through Conflict module, including all related activities
Complete the Growing Through Conflict module assessment at 80% or above

1972b56a-55ba-4fa7-9627-2e2a50d766a3.description: Credentialed as a Heavy Equipment operator with knowledge and skills in the following areas through classwork and simulators on the specific equipment Basic Operational Techniques and Safety, Earthmoving and Grading Fundamentals, and the Articulated Dump Truck Operations Simulator
1972b56a-55ba-4fa7-9627-2e2a50d766a3.name: Heavy Equipment Operator - Articulated Dump Truck

badge_template_activities.title: Basic Operational Techniques and Safety
Earthmoving Fundamentals
Grading Fundamentals
Articulated Dump Truck Operation

59eb1b3a-e3ec-4f2c-902c-076e6ea3a742.description: Credentialed as a Heavy Equipment operator with knowledge and skills in the following areas through classwork and simulators on the specific equipment Basic Operational Techniques and Safety, Earthmoving and Grading Fundamentals, Site Work, Civil Drawings and Excavation Math, and the Backhoe Simulator
59eb1b3a-e3ec-4f2c-902c-076e6ea3a742.name: Heavy Equipment Operator - Backhoe

badge_template_activities.title: Basic Operational Techniques and Safety
Earthmoving Fundamentals
Grading Fundamentals
Site Work
Civil Drawings
Excavation Math
Backhoe Operation

b9a73d1c-6b1c-40cb-a0d2-be90b96e1f98.description: Credentialed as a Heavy Equipment operator with knowledge and skills in the following areas through classwork and simulators on the specific equipment Basic Operational Techniques and Safety, Earthmoving and Grading Fundamentals, Site Work, Civil Drawings and Excavation Math, and the Bulldozer Simulator
b9a73d1c-6b1c-40cb-a0d2-be90b96e1f98.name: Heavy Equipment Operator - Bulldozer

badge_template_activities.title: Basic Operational Techniques and Safety
Earthmoving Fundamentals
Grading Fundamentals
Site Work
Civil Drawings
Excavation Math
Bulldozer Operation

5b2cef1d-082f-4aed-a6f1-27b706b25649.description: Credentialed as a Heavy Equipment operator with knowledge and skills in the following areas through classwork and simulators on the specific equipment Basic Operational Techniques and Safety, Earthmoving and Grading Fundamentals, Site Work, Civil Drawings and Excavation Math, and the Excavator Simulator
5b2cef1d-082f-4aed-a6f1-27b706b25649.name: Heavy Equipment Operator - Excavator

badge_template_activities.title: Basic Operational Techniques and Safety
Earthmoving Fundamentals
Grading Fundamentals
Site Work
Civil Drawings
Excavation Math
Excavator Operation

80ae06ea-878d-41af-a742-745cdebff70d.description: Credentialed as a Heavy Equipment operator with knowledge and skills in the following areas through classwork and simulators on the specific equipment Basic Operational Techniques and Safety, Earthmoving and Grading Fundamentals, Site Work, Civil Drawings and Excavation Math, and the Motor Grader Simulator
80ae06ea-878d-41af-a742-745cdebff70d.name: Heavy Equipment Operator - Motor Grader

badge_template_activities.title: Basic Operational Techniques and Safety
Earthmoving Fundamentals
Grading Fundamentals
Site Work
Civil Drawings
Excavation Math
Motor Grader Operation

ebf2275d-f845-4b64-bfe2-38ca869bfdeb.description: Credentialed as a Heavy Equipment operator with knowledge and skills in the following areas through classwork and simulators on the specific equipment Basic Operational Techniques and Safety, Earthmoving and Grading Fundamentals, Site Work, Civil Drawings and Excavation Math, and the Wheel Loader Simulator
ebf2275d-f845-4b64-bfe2-38ca869bfdeb.name: Heavy Equipment Operator - Wheel Loader

badge_template_activities.title: Basic Operational Techniques and Safety
Earthmoving Fundamentals
Grading Fundamentals
Site Work
Civil Drawings
Excavation Math
Wheel Loader Operation

dcf7e0f4-701f-46b6-a31a-b9bf84114f27.description: This course teaches electronic devices control and power machines used in industries throughout the world, from manufacturing and transportation to energy and construction. Students will learn to operate, adjust, and troubleshoot electronic components, circuits, and systems used in these vital machine applications.
dcf7e0f4-701f-46b6-a31a-b9bf84114f27.name: Industrial Electronics

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the course modules and pass the knowledge based examinations at 80% or better.
Successfully demonstrate to a certified instructor or evaluator the performance task requirements for these modules through simulators and/or real application.

28ce4555-1806-468c-b723-ce8d6befd9ed.description: To be a successful leader, you first need to understand what leadership is and how each leader has a particular style. A solid foundation and awareness of the role and value leadership skills play in your daily life will help you understand those you work with and help you be a competent leader when opportunities arise. Earners will have basic understanding of what leadership is and the five basic styles of leadership. They will know their own style and how to identify the styles of others.
28ce4555-1806-468c-b723-ce8d6befd9ed.name: Introduction to Leadership & Styles of Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Prepare a presentation on what leadership is, its value, and the different leadership styles.

Observe two leaders and compare and contrast their leadership style in relation to leadership styles. Write your findings providing examples. Include an analysis of your leadership style; the strengths, weaknesses, and how your style can help you in your future.

10c3a999-fa31-4ca8-b68c-d8aa268fa4f3.description: Time maximization is using your time precisely and intentionally to fulfill your goals. Learning how to maximize your time involves understanding basic principles about how best to use your time, while avoiding common misconceptions. Earners learn the following: Taking time to maximize time, tracking how time is spent, assessing fixed & variable time, creating & prioritizing a master task list, utilizing a daily planner, and understand flexibility.
10c3a999-fa31-4ca8-b68c-d8aa268fa4f3.name: Maximizing Time

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Maximizing Time module, including all related activities
Complete the Maximizing Time module assessment at 80% or above

ea4af84d-6d0a-40b8-8081-daebec3fec26.description: Individuals are able to identify common types of motor graders and describe their use and operation. They are familiar with motor grader instrumentation, controls, blades and attachments. They can describe typical work activities associated with motor graders including ditching, windrowing, rough grading, finish grading and snow plowing. They are aware of safety, inspection and preventive maintenance guidelines. They know how to safely start up, maneuver and shut down motor graders.
ea4af84d-6d0a-40b8-8081-daebec3fec26.name: Motor Grader Operation

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class
Complete and pass all objectives on the simulator

ab3d266a-4e34-4fd0-8ff4-f5883e361021.description: Most of us love to talk, but how much do we really listen? And when we do listen, how effective are we? Earners discover what effective listening is (and is not), and why it's important. They learn the steps of effective listening with strategies and techniques to become a better listener.
ab3d266a-4e34-4fd0-8ff4-f5883e361021.name: Next-Level Listening

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Next-Level Listening module, including all related activities
Complete the Next-Level Listening module assessment at 80% or above

3bea4507-3823-42d7-9599-225ea878610a.description: The individual who has earned this badge demonstrated competency in each of the skills that make up this badge: Outdoor Leader Experience, Outdoor Leadership Training, Outdoor Ethics Trainer, and Wilderness First Responder. The individual is credentialed as an Outdoor Leader, prepared to plan, lead, and execute outdoor leadership adventures and trainings.
3bea4507-3823-42d7-9599-225ea878610a.name: Outdoor Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Wilderness Education Association Outdoor Leadership Experience
Outdoor Leadership Training Course
Leave No Trace Outdoor Ethics Trainer
SOLO Wilderness First Responder

0d7d8833-07b0-4dbd-8030-6663d1c4dd28.description: The OLTC both broadens and deepens the student’s engagement with the Wilderness Education Association's WEA 6+1 Educational Components (Outdoor Living, Planning and Logistics, Risk Management, Leadership, Environmental Integration, and Education + Judgment) in preparation for serving as an outdoor leader. Students are immersed in an experiential training process through student-led field instruction, Leader-of-the-Day opportunities, trip planning, and more.
0d7d8833-07b0-4dbd-8030-6663d1c4dd28.name: Outdoor Leadership Training Course

badge_template_activities.title: Have at least 10 days of prior backcountry experience. (Prerequisite)
Participate a backcountry field experience with a minimum of five consecutive days.
Implement the WEA 6+1 leadership model in a field setting.
Perform as a Leader of the Day (LOD)
Take part in field instruction experiences.

4de83006-1bda-42c5-91f9-42c5396a4275.description: Individuals can identify and describe the function and purpose of a programmable logic controller (PLC), the features of relay ladder logic instruction categories and PLC programming languages. They understand number systems, the general function of an input/output (I/O) module. This includes discrete, numerical data, analog data, special, remote, power supply, PLC architecture and the purpose of PLC software and firmware. They can compare hardwired and PLC systems. Troubleshooting as well.
4de83006-1bda-42c5-91f9-42c5396a4275.name: Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC)

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed the course modules and passed the knowledge based examinations.
Successfully demonstrated to a certified instructor or evaluator the performance task requirements for these modules on PLC simulators and/or real machines.

74915861-0265-49b6-af64-918a182c6dcc.description: Individuals can identify and describe the importance of safety inspections, methods used to control groundwater and surface water, safety practices and construction methods used around bodies of water, and how to set grades from a benchmark. They understand how grading operations are performed, grades are established for pipelaying operations, and hazardous materials are controlled on a job site. They can interpret layout and markings to determine grading requirements and determine elevations.
74915861-0265-49b6-af64-918a182c6dcc.name: Site Work

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class

d4b3f574-7193-4aec-aed4-cd93c35e66b1.description: Whether you're giving feedback to or receiving feedback from someone, the experience can be emotional and scary. But to grow in your leadership it's critical to learn the art of feedback. Earners will learn how to shift from a fear mindset to a growth mindset with regard to feedback, employ a toolset for making feedback part of your everyday relationships and conversations, and learn techniques for giving and receiving feedback in a variety of relationships and situations.
d4b3f574-7193-4aec-aed4-cd93c35e66b1.name: The Art of Feedback

badge_template_activities.title: Complete The Art of Feedback module, including all related activities
Complete The Art of Feedback module assessment at 80% or above

a5929e24-2cfe-42f0-8259-3250f60f18a8.description: Earners of this badge are introduced to the ideas of leadership. This involves developing both technical and leadership knowledge and capacity, understanding leadership is all about increasing capacity to influence while using the 15 Dimensions of Attentional Leadership. Leaders know what drives them, what they can influence, and are committed to being uncomfortable in the pursuit of great results.
a5929e24-2cfe-42f0-8259-3250f60f18a8.name: Unleashing Your Best Self

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Unlocking Leadership module, including all related activities
Complete the Unlocking Leadership module assessment at 80% or above
Complete the Leading Moment by Moment module, including all related activities
Complete the Leading Moment by Moment module assessment at 80% or above

db4d4fd4-47a2-4ffd-960c-7f21b9397696.description: Individuals can identify and describe chassis components, loader controls, instrumentations, and attachments, as well as basic work activities. They can inspect and maintain, perform startup, warm-up and shutdown procedures, and execute basic maneuvers with a loader, including curling the bucket.
db4d4fd4-47a2-4ffd-960c-7f21b9397696.name: Wheel Loader Operation

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and pass all coursework in the on-line class
Complete and pass all objectives on the simulator

b219dc6f-648a-4776-b94d-9e069c9ca6d4.description: To earn this badge, instructors rate a student artifact or assignment produced in a course that targets Critical Thinking. Examples of artifacts include a research paper, group presentation, project, or skill demonstration. Badges are awarded when adequate evidence is present. The skills are measured through observable behavior or performance.
b219dc6f-648a-4776-b94d-9e069c9ca6d4.name: Workforce Skills: Critical Thinking

badge_template_activities.title: Explanation of Issue(s) - The issue addressed is stated and clarified clearly without serious omissions.
Evidence - Selection of information is sufficient to develop a workable analysis.
Assumptions - Identify assumptions made personally and by others and develop a reasonable context for these assumptions.
Position development - A specific position is developed that shows the issues complexities and acknowledges differing viewpoints.
Conclusion - Conclusion is tied to a range of information and opposing viewpoints, with the outcome stating clear implications.

03080ceb-8369-4ffb-9f5b-0c5af74b2b35.description: To earn this badge, instructors rate a student artifact or assignment produced in a course that targets Ethical Reasoning, which is reasoning about right and wrong human conduct. It requires students to be able to assess their own ethical values and the social context of problems, recognize ethical issues in a variety of settings, think about how different ethical perspectives might be applied to ethical dilemmas and consider the ramifications of alternative actions.
03080ceb-8369-4ffb-9f5b-0c5af74b2b35.name: Workforce Skills: Ethical Reasoning

badge_template_activities.title: Ethical Self-Awareness - Detailed analysis of core beliefs and the origins of such.
Understanding Ethical Concepts - Name the major theory used and can present the gist and details of the theory.
Issue Recognition - Recognize ethical issues in a complex context; may recognize relationships among issues.
Applying Ethical Concepts - Apply ethical concepts to an ethical question accurately.
Evaluation of Ethical Concepts - States a position on the issue while sufficiently recognizing and responding to objections, assumptions and implications of the position.

259045de-918b-48e3-a457-0419b245752b.description: To earn this badge, instructors rate a student artifact or assignment produced in a course that targets Problem Solving. Problem solving is the process of designing, evaluating, and implementing a strategy to answer an open-ended question or achieve a desired goal. Examples of artifacts include a research paper, group presentation, project, or skill demonstration. The skills are measured through observable behavior or performance.
259045de-918b-48e3-a457-0419b245752b.name: Workforce Skills: Problem Solving

badge_template_activities.title: Define Problem - Demonstrates the ability to define a problem with evidence of the most relevant factors. A problem statement is adequately detailed.
Identify Strategies - Identify multiple approaches for solving the problem.

Propose Solutions - Proposes one or more solutions that indicates comprehension of the problem. Solutions are sensitive to contextual factors as well as the one of the following: ethical, logical, or cultural dimensions of the problem.

Evaluate Potential Solutions - Evaluation of solutions is adequate and includes the following: considers history of problem, reviews logic/reasoning, examines feasibility of solution, and weighs impacts of solution.
Implement Solution - Implements the chosen solution in a manner that addresses multiple contextual factors of the problem in at least a surface manner.
Evaluate Outcomes - Reviews results relative to the problem defined with some consideration of need for further work.

8f0063cf-2ace-4495-997a-5bea71cdcf21.description: Instructors rate a student artifact produced in a course that targets Reading. Reading is the process of simultaneously extracting and constructing meaning through interaction and involvement with written language. Readers should approach texts and respond to them with a level of curiosity and the ability to apply aspects of the texts they approach to a variety of aspects in their lives. Examples of artifacts include a research paper, group presentation, project, or skill demonstration.
8f0063cf-2ace-4495-997a-5bea71cdcf21.name: Workforce Skills: Reading

badge_template_activities.title: Comprehension - Uses the text, general background knowledge, and/or specific knowledge of the author’s context to draw inferences about the author’s message and attitude.
Genres - Articulates distinctions among genres and their characteristic conventions.
Relationship to Text - Uses texts in the context of learning to develop a foundation of knowledge and to raise and explore important questions.
Analysis - Identifies relations among ideas, text structure, or other textual features to evaluate how they support an advanced understanding of the text as a whole.
Interpretation - Articulates an understanding of the ways of reading and the range of interpretive strategies applying to a learning path.
Reader’s Voice - Elaborates on the texts (through interpretation or questioning) so as to deepen or enhance an ongoing discussion.

9a75a55b-f58d-4762-9dcd-1d78e3f53624.description: To earn this badge, instructors rate a student artifact or assignment produced in a course that targets Speaking. Speaking is a prepared, purposeful presentation designed to increase knowledge, to foster understanding, or to promote change in the listeners' attitudes, values, beliefs, or behaviors. Examples of artifacts include a research paper, group presentation, project, or skill demonstration. The skills are measured through observable behavior or performance.
9a75a55b-f58d-4762-9dcd-1d78e3f53624.name: Workforce Skills: Speaking

badge_template_activities.title: Organization - Organizational pattern (specific introduction and conclusion, sequenced material within the body, and transitions) is clearly and consistently observable within the presentation.
Language - Language choices are thoughtful and generally support the effectiveness of the presentation. Language in presentation is appropriate to audience.
Delivery - Delivery techniques (posture, gesture, eye contact, and vocal expressiveness) are utilized, make the presentation interesting, and speaker appears comfortable.

Supporting Material - Supporting materials (explanations, examples, illustrations, statistics, analogies) make appropriate reference to information or analysis that generally supports the presentation or establishes the presenter's credibility/authority on the topic.
Central Message - Central message is clear and consistent with the supporting material.

99f72e93-89fe-4e3c-b719-e455ae9fa2df.description: To earn this badge, instructors rate a student artifact or assignment produced in a course that targets Writing. Written communication is the development and expression of ideas in writing. It can involve working with many different writing technologies, and mixing texts, data, and images. Examples of artifacts include a research paper, group presentation, project, or skill demonstration. The skills are measured through observable behavior or performance.
99f72e93-89fe-4e3c-b719-e455ae9fa2df.name: Workforce Skills: Writing

badge_template_activities.title: Context of and Purpose for Writing - Demonstrates adequate consideration of context, audience, and purpose and a clear focus on the assigned task(s)
Content Development - Uses appropriate, relevant, and compelling content to explore ideas within the context of the discipline and shape the whole work.

Genre and Disciplinary Conventions - Demonstrates consistent use of important conventions particular to a specific discipline and/or writing task(s), including organization, content, presentation, and stylistic choices.
Sources and Evidence - Demonstrates consistent use of credible, relevant sources to support ideas that are situated within the discipline and genre of the writing.
Control of Syntax and Mechanics - Uses straightforward language that generally conveys meaning to readers. The language in the portfolio has few errors.
